comments.body: Shouldn't this honor description param, if supplied?

Is there any usecase for that?

Having a description param might confuse users, because the ManageIQ UI is counter-intuative. People might assume "name" is the name visible in the UI, and the description is a space for longer description of what the alert does, while the UI actually shows the "description" where one would expect to find a "name".

Oh, I see there is no description param in code.  That's OK with me.
Please remove it from DOCUMENTATION then :-)

comments.body: ~~I think this should now match by `name` (and method arg should be named `alert_names`)~~
Ignore this, I confused alert profile — matched by name, because that's the unique field — with alerts that are matched by description, which is unique in that table and more user friendly.

comments.body:
python nitpick: if you just want to return [] for missing 'resource' key, write `.get('resources', [])`.
As currently written is effectively `.get('resource', None) or []`, which will also accept `"resources": null` and other any "falsey" values like `"resources": ""`.  Harmless but one day someone will wonder "is this intentional, can server return non-arrays here?"...

oops this is exactly opposite to what @resmo recommended previously https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/32354#discussion_r148456895
I don't really care, LGTM from me on either form.
